p: We chose to test the impact of rapid viral diagnostics on reducing antimicrobial consumption in acutely severely ill adults in a tertiary hospital due to extremely high antibiotic consumption in these patients. Antimicrobial resistance is an increasing problem and at least in Europe the burden of infections with antibiotic-resistant bacteria is highest in infants and in people aged ≥65 years [ 24, 25]. The threat of poor outcome is particularly present in the elderly [ 21, 22].
